title: Smart energy meters installed in public buildings

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am writing to make an open government request for information which I am entitled to under the Freedom of Information Act 2000.
Under the Freedom of Information Act, could you provide the data for the below points, as of the 20th December 2022 (or the closest available date available in data):
1. How many public buildings in your council had working smart energy meters installed on the premises?
- Please provide the data split by property type
- If available, please provide the date/year the smart energy meters were installed
- If available, please provide any available data on when smart energy meters are planned to be installed on the premises which don't already have them
Yours faithfully,
Emma Bertie

Dear Emma Bertie,
Thank you for your request for information relating to smart energy meters
installed in public buildings which we received on 21/12/2022.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. How many public buildings in your council had working smart energy
meters installed on the premises?
Zero smart meters installed.
To our knowledge Smart meters are rarely used on commercial portfolios as
they are mainly limited to smaller sized domestic metering. Most
commercial entities wouldn’t be watching live data to make reductions,
like you could in a domestic setting, as they either require lighting,
heating and so on to operate or they don’t, it tends to be much more
binary than domestic usage. We do however have AMR metering across the
majority of our portfolio of gas and electricity supplies.
- Please provide the data split by property type
N/A, we don’t have any smart meters installed.
- If available, please provide the date/year the smart energy meters were
installed
N/A, we don’t have any smart meters installed.
- If available, please provide any available data on when smart energy
meters are planned to be installed on the premises which don't already
have them.
There are no plans to install smart meters as we utilise AMR meters.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you

Kind Regards,

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
